com.github.dm.jrt.stream.processor

Class Processors

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dm.jrt.stream.processor.Processors

  • public class Processors
extends Object
    Utility class providing several transformation functions to be applied to a routine stream.

    Created by davide-maestroni on 07/06/2016.

    • Method Detail

      • backoffOn

        @NotNull
public static <IN,OUT> Function<StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>,StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>> backoffOn(@Nullable
                                                                                                Runner runner,
                                                                                                int limit,
                                                                                                @NotNull
                                                                                                Backoff backoff)
        Returns a function applying the configuration: invocationConfiguration() .withRunner(runner).withInputLimit(maxInputs).withInputBackoff(backoff).applied().
        This method is useful to easily apply a configuration which will slow down the thread feeding the next routine concatenated to the stream, when the number of buffered inputs exceeds the specified limit. Since waiting on the same runner thread is not allowed, it is advisable to employ a runner instance different from the feeding one, so to avoid deadlock exceptions.
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        runner - the configured runner.
        limit - the maximum number of buffered inputs before starting to slow down the feeding thread.
        backoff - the backoff policy to apply to the feeding thread.
        Returns:
        the transformation function.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified limit is negative.

      • backoffOn

        @NotNull
public static <IN,OUT> Function<StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>,StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>> backoffOn(@Nullable
                                                                                                Runner runner,
                                                                                                int limit,
                                                                                                long delay,
                                                                                                @NotNull
                                                                                                TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Returns a function applying the configuration: invocationConfiguration() .withRunner(runner).withInputLimit(maxInputs).withInputBackoff(delay, timeUnit).applied().
        This method is useful to easily apply a configuration to the next routine concatenated to the stream, which will slow down the thread feeding it, when the number of buffered inputs exceeds the specified limit. Since waiting on the same runner thread is not allowed, it is advisable to employ a runner instance different from the feeding one, so to avoid deadlock exceptions.
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        runner - the configured runner.
        limit - the maximum number of buffered inputs before starting to slow down the feeding thread.
        delay - the constant delay to apply to the feeding thread.
        timeUnit - the delay time unit.
        Returns:
        the transformation function.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified limit or the specified delay are negative.

      • parallel

        @NotNull
public static <IN,OUT> Function<StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>,StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>> parallel(int maxInvocations)
        Returns a function applying the configuration: parallel().invocationConfiguration().withMaxInstances(maxInvocations).applied().
        This method is useful to easily apply a configuration to the next routine concatenated to the stream, which will limit the maximum number of concurrent invocations to the specified value.
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        maxInvocations - the maximum number of concurrent invocations.
        Returns:
        the transformation function.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified number is 0 or negative.

      • parallel

        @NotNull
public static <IN,OUT,AFTER> Function<StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>,StreamBuilder<IN,AFTER>> parallel(int count,
                                                                                                       @NotNull
                                                                                                       Routine<? super OUT,? extends AFTER> routine)
        Returns a function splitting the outputs produced by the stream, so that each group will be processed by a different routine invocation.
        Each output will be assigned to a specific group based on the load of the available invocations.
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        AFTER - the new output type.
        Parameters:
        count - the number of groups.
        routine - the processing routine instance.
        Returns:
        the transformation function.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified count number is 0 or negative.

        Returns a function splitting the outputs produced by the stream, so that each group will be processed by a different routine invocation.

        Type Parameters:

        OUT - the output data type.
        AFTER - the new output type.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the transformation function.

        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified count number is 0 or negative.

      • parallelBy

        @NotNull
public static <IN,OUT,AFTER> Function<StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>,StreamBuilder<IN,AFTER>> parallelBy(@NotNull
                                                                                                         Function<? super OUT,?> keyFunction,
                                                                                                         @NotNull
                                                                                                         Routine<? super OUT,? extends AFTER> routine)
        Returns a function splitting the outputs produced by the stream, so that each group will be processed by a different routine invocation.
        Each output will be assigned to a specific group based on the key returned by the specified function.

        OUT - the output data type.
        AFTER - the new output type.
        Parameters:
        keyFunction - the function assigning a key to each output.

        Returns:
        the transformation function.

      • retry

        @NotNull
public static <IN,OUT> Function<StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>,StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>> retry(int count,
                                                                                            @NotNull
                                                                                            Backoff backoff)
        Returns a function making the stream retrying the whole flow of data at maximum for the specified number of times.
        For each retry the specified backoff policy will be applied before re-starting the flow.
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        count - the maximum number of retries.
        backoff - the backoff policy.
        Returns:
        the transformation function.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified count number is 0 or negative.

      • retry

        @NotNull
public static <IN,OUT> Function<StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>,StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>> retry(@NotNull
                                                                                            BiFunction<? super Integer,? super RoutineException,? extends Long> backoffFunction)
        Returns a function making the stream retrying the whole flow of data until the specified function does not return a null value.
        For each retry the function is called passing the retry count (starting from 1) and the error which caused the failure. If the function returns a non-null value, it will represent the number of milliseconds to wait before a further retry. While, in case the function returns null, the flow of data will be aborted with the passed error as reason.

        Note that no retry will be attempted in case of an explicit abortion, that is, if the error is an instance of AbortException.

        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        backoffFunction - the retry function.
        Returns:
        the transformation function.

      • tryCatch

        @NotNull
public static <IN,OUT> Function<StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>,StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>> tryCatch(@NotNull
                                                                                               Function<? super RoutineException,? extends OUT> catchFunction)
        Returns a function concatenating to the stream a consumer handling invocation exceptions.
        The errors will not be automatically further propagated.
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        catchFunction - the function instance.
        Returns:
        the transformation function.

      • tryCatchAccept

        @NotNull
public static <IN,OUT> Function<StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>,StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>> tryCatchAccept(@NotNull
                                                                                                     BiConsumer<? super RoutineException,? super Channel<OUT,?>> catchConsumer)
        Returns a function concatenating to the stream a consumer handling invocation exceptions.
        The result channel of the backing routine will be passed to the consumer, so that multiple or no results may be generated.
        The errors will not be automatically further propagated.
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        catchConsumer - the bi-consumer instance.
        Returns:
        the transformation function.

      • tryFinally

        @NotNull
public static <IN,OUT> Function<StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>,StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>> tryFinally(@NotNull
                                                                                                 Action finallyAction)
        Returns a function concatenating to the stream an action always performed when outputs complete, even if an error occurred.
        Both outputs and errors will be automatically passed on.
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        finallyAction - the action instance.
        Returns:
        the transformation function.
